alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 3:26PM CDT until August 24 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Conecuh County in south central Alabama... Central Escambia County in south central Alabama... Monroe County in south central Alabama... East Central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 326 PM CDT, Heavy showers and thunderstorms continue to develop in the vicinity of the I65 corridor northwest into the Monroeville and Frisco City area this afternoon, producing torrential rainfall rates over the next few hours. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Brewton, Evergreen, Flomaton, Frisco City, Peterman, East Brewton, Uriah, Castleberry, Excel, Beatrice, Repton, Pollard, Riverview, I65 And AL 113, I65 And US 84, Drewry, Halls Crossroads, Bermuda and Lenox. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
